algorithm_technique: Iterate and count consecutive identical characters, sum differences.
Iterate and count consecutive identical characters, sum (count-1).
problem_summary_simple: Count possible original strings Alice could have typed, allowing at most one character to be repeated.
problem_summary_technical: Count contiguous blocks of identical characters. For each block of size `c`, `c-1` additional strings are possible. Sum these.
key_insights: The number of possible strings is `n` minus the number of adjacent character changes.
This can be solved by counting the number of times `word[i] != word[i+1]`.
Iterate through the string, maintaining a count of consecutive identical characters.
When a character changes or the string ends, add `count - 1` to the total.
The initial string itself is always one possibility.
